    • Method Detail

      • addMissingHighlighting

        public static String addMissingHighlighting(String t,
                            String q)
        If the text matches query text, and doesn't contain any highlighting, the missing highlighting is added. Comparison between the text and query text is case insensitive, and uses the whole query text (no stemming). If the first comparison fails, the query text is converted to its ASCII equivalent, and a second comparison performed.
        If the title text already contains highlighting, no action is taken and the unchanged .
        Please note: this extraordinary measure is needed for a the full text field named dataset_title_ngram. Solr supports highlighting for fixed ngram fields only (a fixed ngram is field with minGramSize = maxGramSize) which is not the case for this field. For this reason, sometimes there is highlighting, but for times when it's missing, this method will add the missing highlighting.
        Parameters:
        t - dataset title
        q - search query text
        Returns:
        dataset title updated with missing highlighting if necessary

      • isFullTextMatchOnly

        public static boolean isFullTextMatchOnly(org.gbif.api.model.registry.search.DatasetSearchResult result,
                          String query)
        Checks if the dataset search result match (highlighted text) only occurred in the full text field. This method goes through all highlighted fields that may be highlighted: 
         
   dataset_title
   keyword
   iso_country_code
   owning_organization_title
   hosting_organization_title
   description
        If there is no highlighted text in any of these fields, it can be inferred that the match must have occurred in the full text field.
        If the query text was null, there can be no matching anyways so the method just returns false.
        Parameters:
        result - DatasetSearchResult
        Returns:
        whether a match only occurred on the full text field or not

      • foldToAscii

        protected static String foldToAscii(String q)
        Uses the solr.ASCIIFoldingFilter to convert a string to its ASCII equivalent. See solr documentation for full details.
        When doing the conversion, this method mirrors GBIF's registry-solr schema configuration for . For example, it uses the KeywordTokenizer that treats the entire string as a single token, regardless of its content. See the solr documentation for more details.
        This method is needed when checking if the query string matches the dataset title. For example, if the query string is "straße", it won't match the dataset title "Schulhof Gymnasium Hürth Bonnstrasse" unless "straße" gets converted to its ASCII equivalent "strasse".
        Parameters:
        q - query string
        Returns:
        query string converted to ASCII equivalent
        See Also:
        addMissingHighlighting(String, String), ASCIIFoldingFilter, KeywordTokenizer
